workflowInfo.workflowDescription: Procedure to enable catalog and Managed ACBs on an existing IMS instance.

variable.name: DFS_DS_VOLUME
variable.label: Volume #2
variable.description: A validation type of VOLSER allows for 1-6 alphanumeric characters (upper case letters only).

variable.name: DFS_IMS_UNIT
variable.label: Device Type #1
variable.abstract: Device type for miscellaneous IMS data sets
variable.description: A validation type of VOLSER allows for 1-8 alphanumeric characters (upper case letters only).

variable.name: DFS_DFSDF_SUFFIX
variable.label: A
variable.abstract: Suffix for the DFSDFxxx IMS proclib member
variable.description:
The DFSDFxxx member of the IMS PROCLIB data set consolidates the specification of processing options for many different IMS components and functions. The CATALOG section defines the IMS catalog for all IMS systems, except those IMS systems for which a CATALOGxxxx section is defined.
The 3 character length string will be added to the DFSDF name.

variable.name: DFS_CATALOG_DS
variable.label: CATALOG
variable.description: HLQ for where the IMS catalog database will be allocated.

variable.name: DFS_HWSRCDR_DS
variable.label: HWSRCDR
variable.abstract: Data set for IMS Connect recorder trace
variable.description: Data set for IMS Connect recorder trace

variable.name: DFS_PROCLIB_DS
variable.label: PROCLIB
variable.description: Contains procedures that are built during system definition

variable.name: DFS_CATLOG_DS
variable.label: CATLOG
variable.description: Data set where the log output for the Catalog Populate Utility will be written.

variable.name: DFS_INSTALL_DS
variable.label: INSTALL
variable.abstract: Data set where the install JCLs can be saved
variable.description: Data set where the JCLs used in the workflow can be saved.

variable.name: DFS_JCLPDS_DS
variable.label: JCLPDS
variable.abstract: Data set where GENJCL are located
variable.description: Data set where GENJCL are located

variable.name: DFS_DBDLIB_DS
variable.label: DBDLIB
variable.abstract: Data set containing the database description blocks
variable.description: DBDLIB data set contains the database description blocks (DBDs) that are created by the Database Description Generation (DBDGEN) utility

variable.name: DFS_PSBLIB_DS
variable.label: PSBLIB
variable.abstract: Data set containing the program specification blocks
variable.description: PSBLIB data set contains the program specification blocks (PSBs) created by the Program Specification Block Generation (PSBGEN) utility

variable.name: DFS_ACBLIB_DS
variable.label: ACBLIB
variable.abstract: Data set containing the application description and database control blocks
variable.description: ACBLIB contains the application control blocks (ACBs) that are created by the Application Control Blocks Maintenance (ACBGEN) utility

step.name: gatherImsCatalogInfo
step.title: Specify IMS and catalog information
step.description: Specify the IMS information needed for installing catalog and enabling Managed ACBs.

step.name: allocateWorkingDataSet
step.title: Create data set for saving catalog JCLs
step.description: Create data set for saving catalog JCLs

step.name: scratchExistingDataSets
step.title: Scratch existing catalog and IMS directory data sets
step.description: Scratch existing catalog and IMS directory data sets
step.instructions:
This step will scratch the existing catalog and IMS directory data sets if they exist.
This step is optional and can be skipped
They IMS catalog data sets to be scratched include:
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.CATDEF
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.A00001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.B00001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.C00001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.D00001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.L00001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.X00001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCX000.A00001
IMS directory data sets to be scratched
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.BSDS
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.DI1001
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.DI1002
${instance-DFS_CATALOG_DS}.DFSCD000.STG

step.name: allocateCatalogDatabaseDataSets
step.title: Create IMS catalog database
step.description: Allocate and define IMS catalog database resources
step.instructions:
This step allocates the IMS catalog database data sets, registers the IMS catalog database to the RECON, and defines the default PSB and DBD members.
Steps:
Installs the DBDs and PSBs for the IMS catalog from the ${instance-DFS_RESLIB_DS} data set to the ${instance-DFS_DBDLIB_DS} and ${instance-DFS_PSBLIB_DS} data sets.
The catalog DBDs are DFSCD000 and DFSCX000.
The catalog PSBs are DFSCPL00, DFSCP000, DFSCP001.
These are reserved names and cannot be changed or used for other resources.
Runs the ACB Maintenance utility to generate the ACB for the IMS catalog.
Uses the Database Recovery Control utility (DSPURX00) to register the IMS catalog with DBRC and to define the master database and partitions in the RECON data sets.

step.name: createDfsdfxxxMembers
step.title: Create DFSDFxxx proclib members for loading and running catalog with managed ACBs
step.description: Create DFSDFxxx proclib members for loading and running catalog with managed ACBs
step.instructions:
This step creates two IMS proclib members.
DFSDFLOD member is created to be used for populating the IMS catalog and building the IMS catalog directory data sets. In the CATALOG section CATALOG=Y and ACBMGMT=ACBLIB.
DFSDF${instance-DFS_DFSDF_SUFFIX} member is created for using IMS catalog with managed ACBs. In the CATALOG section CATALOG=Y and ACBMGMT=CATALOG is specified.
Copy the contents of the DFSDF${instance-DFS_DFSDF_SUFFIX} data set to an existing DFSDFxxx member, or use this member as is.
Specify the execution parameters for DFSDF=xxx in the DFSPBxxx PROCLIB member. The 3 character value should correspond to the name of the DFSDF${instance-DFS_DFSDF_SUFFIX} member which indicates CATALOG=Y
If the DFSDF${instance-DFS_DFSDF_SUFFIX} member is already existing in the ${instance-DFS_PROCLIB_DS} data set it will not be overwritten.

step.name: loadCatalogDB
step.title: Load IMS catalog database
step.description: Load the IMS catalog database by running the IMS Catalog Populate utility (DFS3PU00) in a DL/I batch region. DFS3PU00 will execute and specify MANAGEDACBS=SETUP.
step.instructions: This step loads the IMS CATALOG database using DFS3PU00 utility

step.name: imageCopy
step.title: Take an image copy of HALDB catalog data sets
step.description: Take an image copy of HALDB catalog data sets
step.instructions:
This step will take an image copy of the catalog data sets using the Database Recovery Control utility (DSPURX00).
It will use the ICJCL in the ${instance-DFS_JCLPDS_DS} data set to generate a JCL for taking the image copy.
The JCL will use the job card from the default JOBJCL in the the ${instance-DFS_JCLPDS_DS} data set.
You can also specify JOB(member) as part of the SYSIN GENJCL statement and the specified execution member will be used to produce the job statement.
The output of the image copy can be found in the SDSF status of jobs. For more information on GENJCL see GENJCL.IC
For more information on database recovery see Database Recovery Control utility (DSPURX00) This step is optional and can be skipped.
